title: Angle Between Lines and Distance Quiz
description: Test your understanding of angles between lines and point-to-line distances.

questions.question: How do you find the angle between two lines?
options: Take dot product of direction vectors
Take cross product of direction vectors
questions.explanation: cos θ = |b₁ · b₂| / (|b₁| |b₂|), using the dot product of direction vectors.

questions.question: The angle between lines is always:
questions.explanation: The angle between lines is defined as the acute angle, so it's always between 0° and 90°.

questions.question: What does distance = 0 indicate?
questions.explanation: If the distance from a point to a line is zero, the point lies on the line.

questions.question: The formula for distance from point to line uses:
questions.explanation: Distance = |(c - a) × b| / |b|, using the cross product.

questions.question: For perpendicular lines, the angle θ satisfies:
questions.explanation: Perpendicular lines have direction vectors with dot product zero, so cos θ = 0.
